titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Sterling Silliphant Papers, 1957-1985

profiledesc.creation: Text rekeyed by Caroline Cub from in-house paper finding aid, February 2006. Machine-readable finding aid derived from rekeyed finding aid, encoding added via Notetab Pro. Date of source: DDMMYYYY.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid prepared using Describing Archives: a Content Standard

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Collection consists of film and television scripts by Silliphant. Also includes correspondence, clippings, and production notes.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections.

did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. Please contact the UCLA Library, Department of Special Collections Reference Desk for paging information.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Advance notice required for access.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Copyright of portions of this collection has been assigned to the Department of Special Collections, UCLA. All requests for permission to publish or quote from manuscripts must be submitted in writing to the Manuscripts Librarian. Permission for publication is given on behalf of the Department of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Sterling Silliphant Papers (Collection Number 1079). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Silliphant was born on Jan. 16, 1918 in Detroit, MI; graduated magna cum laude from Univ. of So. Calif., 1938; worked in advertising and promotion for Walt Disney and 20th Century Fox until 1952; produced a few films in the 1950s before becoming a screenwriter for both feature films and television; his successful television series include Naked city and Route 66; films include The Joe Louis story (1953), In the heat of the night (1967), Charly (1968), Marlowe (1969), The Poseidon adventure (1972), The towering inferno (1974); won an Academy Award for In the heat of the night in 1967; was a prolific novelist who published more than 50 books; moved to Thailand in late 1980s, where he was active in developing the region's film industry; died in Bangkok on Apr. 26, 1996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of film and television scripts by Silliphant. Also includes correspondence, clippings, and production notes.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Stirling Silliphant Collection. Available at Arts Library Special Collections, UCLA.

note.p: Versions of the screenplay eventually produced as "The Towering Inferno." Screenplays and sections are arranged in chronological order of revision; each screenplay incorporates changes of the previous versions.
